resources.string: Ideal place to enjoy the view on Hamburg\'s famous harbour. Sit on the landing wall, have a cool drink and watch the sunset with friends!
Huge park with different themes, plenty of places to chill and take a break from the city life.
Take off your shoes, feel the sand between your toes and watch the ships enter Hamburg\'s harbour. Pro tip: Take a walk at night with friends - it\'s a beautiful view!
Gone are the days of boring libraries with dusty books and strict librarians shushing you. Bücherhallen have every form of modern entertainment for you to use and borrow.
Wide ranges of green areas, a lake to have a swim in and playgrounds for your kids. Bonus: Watch the local Quidditch team train on Sundays!
Literally "warehouse city" - Hamburg\'s Speicherstadt is the world\'s largest warehouse complex with beautiful brick architecture. There are plenty of activities to discover!
After many revisions and rebuilds, the current City Hall is an impressive sight to behold. Open to the public with optional guided tours!
Hailed as a technical sensation when it first opened a hundred years ago, the St. Pauli Elbtunnel is still going strong as a place for exhibitions and taking lovely strolls.
Belovedly called "Michel" by locals. Hamburg\'s most famous church offers a unique view on the city on its viewing platform. Don\'t miss it!
Cozy bar to hang out and play some billard at after work.
Amazing place to have a beer at and get started for a long night of partying.
Super charming, quaint pub for small groups.
No better place for enjoying live music and hipster culture than here.
A classic club at the famous Reeperbahn. Always packed and vibrant with energy!
The Schanzenbäcker offers sweet, mushy Franzbrötchen (as they should be!) - quality can vary greatly though, where dry Franzbrötchen sometimes slip in.
